comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: One Captain William Dennis was a yacht skipper at this time, but I'm not certain this guy fits the profile! NYT of June 17, 1914 reports his resignation as skipper of the Vanitie. query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9F02EFDE143AE633A...

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: Story in The New York Times, May 1, 1914, reports that the launching of the newly-built yacht, Vanitie, is anticipated on May 5. [The photo bears Bain's date, May 6.] Captain Dennis has arrived at Newport [RI] with a crew of 34, who will race the Vanitie in July, in special challenge races sponsored by the New York Yacht Club: query.nytimes.com/mem/archive-free/pdf?res=9E0CE1DE173AE6...

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: chroniclingamerica.loc.gov/lccn/sn89066651/1914-06-18/ed-... The Hayti herald. (Hayti, Mo.) 1908-1922, June 18, 1914, Image 8 has a picture of the Vanitie's skipper and it certainly could be the same man.

comment.author: 33593953@N02
comment._content: Thanks, everyone, for figuring out the likely identification and context for the photo.  We'll add information when we next update the record.
